title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 5604.5 - Prizes won by prohibited persons, self-excluded and excluded contestants
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 5604.5 - Prizes won by prohibited persons, self-excluded and excluded contestants

State Regulations

Any prize won by a prohibited person, other than prizes
that may be used as offsets pursuant to Racing, Pari-Mutuel Wagering and

Breeding Law section 1404(b)(i), shall be null and void and a registrant may
pursue recovery of any such prize from the prohibited person who won such
prize. Upon discovery within one year of the conclusion of a contest that a
prohibited person has won or may be entitled to win a contest prize, a
registrant shall recalculate all prize winnings for such contest as if such
prohibited person had not entered such contest and shall for each contestant
award and credit to each contestant the difference between the recalculated
prize award and the prize already awarded, if any. A registrant may submit to
the commission, for review and approval, a plan that establishes alternative
benefits to contestants in lieu of recalculated prize awards. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9

5604.5

Adopted

New

York State Register October 18, 2023/Volume XLV, Issue 42, eff. 10/18/2023

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
